results.authors: By Jack Farchy and Benjamin Bain
results.headline: Trafigura to Pay $55 Million Over Fuel Oil Manipulation
results.summary: Trafigura Group agreed to pay $55 million to settle allegations from the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission that it manipulated a fuel oil benchmark and blocked employees from cooperating with regulators.

results.headline: Putin Expands Defense Shuffle, Appoints Allies From Inner Circle
results.summary: President Vladimir Putin dismissed four deputy defense ministers and appointed two people with close ties to the Kremlin elite as he continued a shake-up of Russia’s wartime leadership.

results.headline: Fraud Police Probing Ex-Glencore Staff Plan to Press Charges
results.summary: British prosecutors investigating former Glencore Plc employees over bribery allegations said they plan to bring long-awaited criminal charges.

results.authors: By Daryna Krasnolutska and Olesia Safronova
results.headline: Maimed Ukrainian Power System May Get More European Bank Support
results.summary: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development is studying increased support to help Ukraine overcome a critical shortage of electricity as a third winter in wartime approaches.

results.headline: Adidas Opens Fraud Probe in China After Whistleblower Letter
results.summary: Adidas AG is investigating allegations of corruption in China after receiving an anonymous letter exposing potential compliance violations by some employees.

results.headline: Thai Royalists Make Risky Bet in Fresh Showdown With Thaksin
results.summary: Last August, former Thai leader Thaksin Shinawatra returned to his homeland after 15 years in exile following a deal with royalists who once ousted him in a coup. That marriage of convenience is now at risk of falling apart, potentially unleashing more political turmoil.

results.headline: Venezuela Watchers Say Maduro Will Seek to Evade Latest Sanctions
results.summary: Venezuelan activists and policy analysts are calling for tougher sanctions and investigations into how President Nicolás Maduro’s government is using cryptocurrencies to get around international restrictions.

results.headline: Florida School Choice Programs Are Forcing Public Schools to Close
results.summary: State voucher programs direct billions of dollars with little oversight — opening the door to compelled religion.

results.headline: South Africa Election: ANC-DA Deal Sets Country on New Path
results.summary: Leaders face the gargantuan task of keeping a rickety coalition together — and reviving the economy.

results.headline: Alan Bates, Gordon Brown and Tracey Emin Headline in King's Birthday Honours
results.summary: Post Office campaigner Alan Bates, former prime minister Gordon Brown and artist Tracey Emin are among the famous faces recognised in the King's Birthday Honours list.
